New Records: Wyatt Langford is the first Rangers rookie to ever win a game with a walk-off grand slam
Langford is the 24th rookie since 1944 to hit a walk-off grand slam
Key Match Events: Langford ripped a 3-2 slider 407 feet into the second deck in the left-field corner to lift the Texas Rangers to a miraculous 7-4 comeback win
Post-Match Reflections: Langford is the seventh-youngest MLB player to hit a walk-off grand slam and the youngest American League player to ever, at 22 years, and 293 days old
Bochy on Langford, scratching for hits and Heaney's tough luck...
Miscellaneous Highlights: No! Langford said before taking a timeout with the Rangers trailing 4-3 with one out and the bases loaded
Bochy joked that Langford is able to handle the poor strike calls because he's gotten used to it
